text: When you listen to Caverns 1 from the original game, you can only appreciate the work Matsuoka put in this remix: I love the one-two sound starting at 1:00, as well as the hi-hats at 1:40; mixed with the chorus and the strings, it makes for a very deep and menacing ambience perfectly fitting Metroid. I finished Samus Returns this week-end and while it was a solid remake, I just can't put my finger as to why the 10 hours felt so long. It might have to do with the fact that I played AM2R before, which to be honest I find many levels above this game. I don't think I'll ever be a fan of 2.5D games, but I do have to say the 3D effect was very well done when turned on. It just had this generally bland feeling to it. Apart from a boss battle or two, I never really got excited even when I got new upgrades. It's a good game, it just never reached the addictive and wow effect for me.

text: I love AM2R and there's several things I like better than in this game, but I still enjoyed this one a little more. Mostly, it was an actual huge 2D Metroid and I actually got lost, like I was really exploring a deep cave. I'd never got lost in a Metroid game before, except possibly Super Metroid, so that was really exciting. I've replayed this already many times.
